p.s: The author tries to convince the reader in several ways, for example using the structure of the text.
It is split into four about equally long parts: An introduction, containing ana statement and example, and then an example, to prove the statement in the introduction.
The third part contains firstly tethe example for a statement and argument which then is found later in the same part.
The last part expands the statentstatement from the third, making it the other main topic of the text.
Overall, it is very different from other argumentative texts.
The example at the beginning sets the readersreader's mind and influences them.
The example in the second part helps the reader understand the situation and makes it seem dangerous.
The positive example in the third part explains how it should be, but also claims it is the migrantsmigrants' fault they aren't educated.
This information is easy to receive, altoughalthough not directly mentioned in the text, which makes the reader think it is their own conclusion and as such more reliable.
Only in the last part, the author states his true intention, even though he has no examples nor proveproof.
The first three parts are reallreally working together to create this assumption, and because there were examples and facts in it, the reader thinks the statement is also proved.
Another device to influence the reader are stylistic devices.
One of them is the comparison between 100m and the signals for integration (ll. 1-3).
By saying it is worse than 100000000 pounds, the reader has an idea of how big the problem is even though he has no information yet.
Another one is the repetition of sentences starting with My parents (ll. 11-14).
It expresses how important the parents are.
They are also synonym for all refugees which should try to learn englishEnglish.
The repetition and importance also supports the important role of the parents or refugees in the process, as I stated in the structure analysis.
A third stylistic device is the personification of the problem (ll. 18-19), which makes the problem more understandable for readers who haven't got it yet.
